title: Wit's Ends Rise.
body:
What about give more "usage" to the Wit ends item adding a powerful active like the Quick Silver?

 {{item:3091}} 

> New Build Path:
> {{item:3140}} + {{item:1043}} + 350g (2700g total cost)
> 
> Stats:
> 
> +42% attack speed
> +30 magic resistance
> 
> UNIQUE ACTIVE – QUICKSILVER: Removes all debuffs from your champion. 90 second cooldown.
> 
> Unique: Basic attacks deal 42 bonus magic damage on hit.
> Unique: Basic attacks increase your magic resistance by 5 for 5 seconds and reduce the target's magic resistance by 5 on hit (stacks up to 5 times).

Is better than the actual? Is too OP? Worst build path?

Share your thoughts!

replies.body:
Brutalizer need more final build paths like QSS too

{{item:3134}} can be a good into {{item:3508}} or {{item:3050}} IMO.

{{item:3508}} 

{{item:3134}}  + {{item:1053}}  + 863g = 3000g

> 60 AD
> 20% CD
> 10%  Life Steal
> 
> Unique passive: 10% Armor Pen.
> 
> Unique Passive: basic attacks restore 2 - 8 % mana, the value depends of the missing mana.

or

What about turn Zeke Herald into the Abyssal Scepter AD version:

Zeke Herald {{item:3050}} 

> Brutalizer {{item:3134}} + Vampire Scepter {{item:1053}}  + 363g (total cost 2500g)
> 
> Stats
> +40 attack damage	
> +10% life steal
> +20% cooldown reduction
> 
> Aura	Unique: Reduces the armor of nearby enemies by 15 (700 range).

This can be a good item to AD Caster too. Also give a new build path for the Brutalizer and can turn Zeke Herald into a item with a better niche, I feel that Zeke need some love and a rework like this can push Zeke in the right way.

So the two items actually stay in a bad spot, Brutalizer need more build paths, so if a great chance to put in Zeke's or Reaver.
